exports.name: magma_device_import
exports.description: Imports and takes ownership of a channel to a device.

arguments.name: device_channel
arguments.description: A channel connecting to a gpu class device.

exports.name: magma_device_release
exports.description: Releases a handle to a device

exports.name: magma_device_query
exports.description: Performs a query synchronously. On MAGMA_STATUS_OK, a given query |id| will return either a buffer in |result_buffer_out|, or a value in |result_out|. A NULL pointer may be provided for whichever result parameter is not needed.

exports.name: magma_device_create_connection
exports.description: Opens a connection to a device.

exports.name: magma_connection_release
exports.description: Releases the given connection.

exports.name: magma_connection_get_error
exports.description: If a system driver error occurs, the connection will be closed, and this interface will eventually return the error. This interface does not flush messages that may be pending (see magma_connection_flush).

exports.name: magma_connection_create_context
exports.description: Creates a context on the given connection.

exports.name: magma_connection_release_context
exports.description: Releases the context associated with the given id.

exports.name: magma_connection_create_buffer
exports.description: Creates a memory buffer of at least the given size.

arguments.name: id_out
arguments.description: The buffer id of the buffer.

exports.name: magma_connection_release_buffer
exports.description: Releases the given memory buffer.

exports.name: magma_connection_import_buffer
exports.description: Imports and takes ownership of the buffer referred to by the given handle.

arguments.name: size_out
arguments.description: The size of the buffer in bytes.

arguments.name: id_out
arguments.description: The buffer id of the buffer.

exports.name: magma_connection_create_semaphore
exports.description: Creates a semaphore.

exports.name: magma_connection_release_semaphore
exports.description: Releases the given semaphore.

exports.name: magma_connection_import_semaphore
exports.description: Imports and takes ownership of the semaphore referred to by the given handle.

exports.name: magma_connection_perform_buffer_op
exports.description: Perform an operation on a range of a buffer

arguments.name: length
arguments.description: Length (in bytes) of the region to operate on.

exports.name: magma_connection_map_buffer
exports.description: Maps a buffer range onto the hardware in the connection's address space at the given address. Depending on the MSD this may automatically commit and populate that range.

arguments.name: hw_va
arguments.description: Destination virtual address for the mapping.

arguments.name: length
arguments.description: Length in bytes of the range to map.

exports.name: magma_connection_unmap_buffer
exports.description: Releases the mapping at the given hardware address.

arguments.name: hw_va
arguments.description: A hardware virtual address associated with an existing mapping of the given buffer.

exports.name: magma_connection_execute_command
exports.description: Submits command buffers for execution on the hardware.

arguments.name: descriptor
arguments.description: A pointer to the command descriptor.

exports.name: magma_connection_execute_immediate_commands
exports.description: Submits a series of commands for execution on the hardware without using a command buffer.

arguments.name: command_count
arguments.description: The number of commands in the provided buffer.

arguments.name: command_buffers
arguments.description: An array of command_count magma_inline_command_buffer structs.

exports.name: magma_connection_flush
exports.description: Incurs a round-trip to the system driver, used to ensure all previous messages have been observed, but not necessarily completed.  If a system driver error occurs, the connection will be closed, and this interface will return the error.

exports.name: magma_connection_get_notification_channel_handle
exports.description: Returns a handle that can be waited on to determine when the connection has data in the notification channel. This channel has the same lifetime as the connection and must not be closed by the client.

exports.name: magma_connection_read_notification_channel
exports.description: Reads a notification from the channel into the given buffer.  Message sizes may vary depending on the MSD.  If the buffer provided is too small for the message, MAGMA_STATUS_INVALID_ARGS will be returned and the size of message will be returned in the buffer_size_out parameter.

arguments.name: buffer
arguments.description: Buffer into which to read notification data.

arguments.name: buffer_size_out
arguments.description: Returned size of the notification data written to the buffer, or 0 if there are no messages pending.

arguments.name: more_data_out
arguments.description: True if there is more notification data waiting.

exports.name: magma_buffer_clean_cache
exports.description: Cleans, and optionally invalidates, the cache for the region of memory specified by the given buffer, offset, and size, and write the contents to ram.

arguments.name: offset
arguments.description: An offset into the buffer. Must be less than or equal to the buffer's size.

arguments.name: size
arguments.description: Size of region to be cleaned. Offset + size must be less than or equal to the buffer's size.

exports.name: magma_buffer_set_cache_policy
exports.description: Configures the cache for the given buffer.

exports.name: magma_buffer_get_cache_policy
exports.description: Queries the cache policy for a buffer.

exports.name: magma_buffer_set_name
exports.description: Sets a name for the buffer for use in debugging tools.

arguments.name: name
arguments.description: The 0-terminated name of the buffer. May be truncated.

exports.name: magma_buffer_get_info
exports.description: Get information on a magma buffer

arguments.name: info_out
arguments.description: Pointer to struct that receives the buffer info.

exports.name: magma_buffer_get_handle
exports.description: Gets a platform handle for the given buffer. This can be used to perform a CPU mapping of the buffer using the standard syscall.  The handle may be released without invalidating such CPU mappings.

exports.name: magma_buffer_export
exports.description: Exports the given buffer, returning a handle that may be imported into a connection.

exports.name: magma_semaphore_signal
exports.description: Signals the given semaphore.

exports.name: magma_semaphore_reset
exports.description: Resets the given semaphore.

exports.name: magma_semaphore_export
exports.description: Exports the given semaphore, returning a handle that may be imported into a connection

exports.name: magma_poll
exports.description: Waits for at least one of the given items to meet a condition. Does not reset any semaphores. When MAGMA_STATUS_OK is returned, results are returned in the items array. MAGMA_STATUS_TIMED_OUT is returned if no conditions are met before the given timeout expires. If the notification channel handle is included in the item list, and the magma connection is closed, then MAGMA_STATUS_CONNECTION_LOST is returned.

arguments.name: items
arguments.description: Array of poll items. Type should be either MAGMA_POLL_TYPE_SEMAPHORE or MAGMA_POLL_TYPE_HANDLE. Condition may be set to MAGMA_POLL_CONDITION_SIGNALED OR MAGMA_POLL_CONDITION_READABLE. If condition is 0 the item is ignored. Item results are set to the condition that was satisfied, otherwise 0. If the same item is given twice the behavior is undefined.

arguments.name: count
arguments.description: Number of poll items in the array.

arguments.name: timeout_ns
arguments.description: Time in ns to wait before returning MAGMA_STATUS_TIMED_OUT.

exports.name: magma_initialize_tracing
exports.description: Initializes tracing. This should be called on Fuchsia; on other platforms it's not needed and will just close the given handle.

arguments.name: channel
arguments.description: An open connection to a tracing provider.

exports.name: magma_initialize_logging
exports.description: Initializes logging, used for debug and some exceptional error reporting. This should be called on Fuchsia; on other platforms it's not needed and will just close the given handle.

arguments.name: channel
arguments.description: An open connection to the syslog service.

exports.name: magma_connection_enable_performance_counter_access
exports.description: Tries to enable access to performance counters. Returns MAGMA_STATUS_OK if counters were successfully enabled or MAGMA_STATUS_ACCESS_DENIED if channel is for the wrong device and counters were not successfully enabled previously.

arguments.name: connection
arguments.description: An open connection to a device.

arguments.name: channel
arguments.description: A handle to a channel to a gpu-performance-counter device.

exports.name: magma_connection_enable_performance_counters
exports.description: Enables a set of performance counters (the precise definition depends on the driver). Disables enabled performance counters that are not in the new set. Performance counters will also be automatically disabled on connection close. Performance counter access must have been enabled using magma_connection_enable_performance_counter_access before calling this method.

arguments.name: connection
arguments.description: An open connection to a device.

exports.name: magma_connection_create_performance_counter_buffer_pool
exports.description: Create a pool of buffers that performance counters can be dumped into. Performance counter access must have been enabled using magma_connection_enable_performance_counter_access before calling this method.

arguments.name: connection
arguments.description: An open connection to a device.

arguments.name: pool_id_out
arguments.description: A new pool id. Must not currently be in use.

arguments.name: notification_handle_out
arguments.description: A handle that should be waited on.

exports.name: magma_connection_release_performance_counter_buffer_pool
exports.description: Releases a pool of performance counter buffers. Performance counter access must have been enabled using magma_connection_enable_performance_counter_access before calling this method.

arguments.name: connection
arguments.description: An open connection to a device.

exports.name: magma_connection_add_performance_counter_buffer_offsets_to_pool
exports.description: Adds a an array of buffers + offset to the pool. |offsets[n].buffer_id| is the koid of a buffer that was previously imported using ImportBuffer(). The same buffer may be added to multiple pools. The pool will hold on to a reference to the buffer even after ReleaseBuffer is called.  When dumped into this entry, counters will be written starting at |offsets[n].offset| bytes into the buffer, and up to |offsets[n].offset| + |offsets[n].size|. |offsets[n].size| must be large enough to fit all enabled counters. Performance counter access must have been enabled using magma_connection_enable_performance_counter_access before calling this method.

arguments.name: connection
arguments.description: An open connection to a device.

arguments.name: offsets
arguments.description: An array of offsets to add.

arguments.name: offsets_count
arguments.description: The number of elements in offsets.

exports.name: magma_connection_remove_performance_counter_buffer_from_pool
exports.description: Removes every offset of a buffer from the pool. Performance counter access must have been enabled using magma_connection_enable_performance_counter_access before calling this method.

arguments.name: connection
arguments.description: An open connection to a device.

exports.name: magma_connection_dump_performance_counters
exports.description: Triggers dumping of the performance counters into a buffer pool. May fail silently if there are no buffers in the pool. |trigger_id| is an arbitrary ID assigned by the client that can be returned in OnPerformanceCounterReadCompleted. Performance counter access must have been enabled using magma_connection_enable_performance_counter_access before calling this method.

arguments.name: connection
arguments.description: An open connection to a device.

arguments.name: trigger_id
arguments.description: An arbitrary ID assigned by the client that will be returned in OnPerformanceCounterReadCompleted.

exports.name: magma_connection_clear_performance_counters
exports.description: Sets the values of all listed performance counters to 0. May not be supported by some hardware. Performance counter access must have been enabled using magma_connection_enable_performance_counter_access before calling this method.

arguments.name: connection
arguments.description: An open connection to a device.

exports.name: magma_connection_read_performance_counter_completion
exports.description: Reads one performance counter completion event, if available.

arguments.name: connection
arguments.description: An open connection to a device.

arguments.name: trigger_id_out
arguments.description: The trigger ID for this event.

arguments.name: buffer_id_out
arguments.description: The buffer ID for this event.

arguments.name: buffer_offset_out
arguments.description: The buffer offset for this event.

arguments.name: time_out
arguments.description: The monotonic time this event happened.

arguments.name: result_flags_out
arguments.description: A set of flags giving more information about this event.

exports.name: magma_virt_connection_create_image
exports.description: Creates an image buffer backed by a buffer collection given a DRM format and optional modifier, as specified in the create info.

arguments.name: size_out
arguments.description: The size of the image buffer in bytes

arguments.name: buffer_id_out
arguments.description: The ID of the image buffer.

exports.name: magma_virt_connection_get_image_info
exports.description: Returns parameters for an image created with virtmagma_create_image.

virtmagma-internal.name: magma_internal_release_handle
virtmagma-internal.description: Releases the given handle.  Must be called to free resources on the host for each handle returned by interfaces such as magma_get_buffer_handle2.

virtmagma-internal.name: magma_internal_map
virtmagma-internal.description: Maps the given buffer handle into the virtmagma VMAR.

arguments.name: length
arguments.description: Page-aligned number of bytes to be mapped.

arguments.name: address_out
arguments.description: The returned CPU virtual address for the start of the buffer.

virtmagma-internal.name: magma_internal_unmap
virtmagma-internal.description: Releases the VMAR mapping for the given buffer handle. Should be paired with each call to magma_internal_map2.
